info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 7:26PM PDT until April 29 at 9:15PM PDT by NWS Spokane WA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following county, Kootenai.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. The Ridge Creek Burn Scar is within this Flood Advisory and has seen similar rainfall amounts.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Kootenai County, and the Ridge Creek Burn Scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PDT THIS EVENING
